diff_hunk:
@@ -173,6 +174,14 @@ def test_constant_folding(self):
         rewritten_graph = test_util.grappler_optimize(g, [mel_matrix])
         self.assertEqual(1, len(rewritten_graph.node))
 
+  def test_num_spectrogram_bins(self):
+    with self.test_session(use_gpu=True):
+      mel_matrix_np = spectrogram_to_mel_matrix(
+          20, 129, 8000.0, 125.0, 3800.0)
+      mel_matrix = mel_ops.linear_to_mel_weight_matrix(
+          20, constant_op.constant(129), 8000.0, 125.0, 3800.0)
body:
This isn't a strong test because we library writers can "peek" at constant ops to get their value. :) To truly test if the number of bins can be a tensor, please make a placeholder int32 tensor. 

Here's an example:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/signal/python/kernel_tests/shape_ops_test.py#L310
